blocks.name: df-refs
blocks.content: Define the class of all reflexive sets. It is used only by ~ df-refrels . We use subset relation ` _S ` ( ~ df-ssr ) here to be able to define converse reflexivity ( ~ df-cnvrefs ), see also the comment of ~ df-ssr . The elements of this class are not necessarily relations (versus ~ df-refrels ). Note the similarity of the definitions ~ df-refs , ~ df-syms and ~ df-trs , cf. comments of ~ dfrefrels2 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 19-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: df-refrels
blocks.content: Define the class of reflexive relations. This is practically ~ dfrefrels2 (which reveals that ` RefRels ` can not include proper classes like ` _I ` as is elements, see comments of ~ dfrefrels2 ). Another alternative definition is ~ dfrefrels3 . The element of this class and the reflexive relation predicate ( ~ df-refrel ) are the same, that is, ` ( R e. RefRels <-> RefRel R ) ` when ` A ` is a set, see ~ elrefrelsrel . This definition is similar to the definitions of the classes of symmetric ( ~ df-symrels ) and transitive ( ~ df-trrels ) relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 7-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: df-refrel
blocks.content: Define the reflexive relation predicate. (Read: ` R ` is a reflexive relation.) This is a surprising definition, see the comment of ~ dfrefrel3 . Alternate definitions are ~ dfrefrel2 and ~ dfrefrel3 . For sets, being an element of the class of reflexive relations ( ~ df-refrels ) is equivalent to satisfying the reflexive relation predicate, that is ` ( R e. RefRels <-> RefRel R ) ` when ` R ` is a set, see ~ elrefrelsrel . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 16-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: dfrefrels2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the class of reflexive relations. This is a 0-ary class constant, which is recommended for definitions (see the 1. Guideline at ~ http://us.metamath.org/ileuni/mathbox.html ). Proper classes (like ` _I ` , see ~ iprc ) are not elements of this (or any) class: if a class is an element of another class, it is not a proper class but a set, see ~ elex . So if we use 0-ary constant classes as our main definitions, they are valid only for sets, not for proper classes. For proper classes we use predicate-type definitions like ~ df-refrel . See also the comment of ~ df-rels . Note that while elementhood in the class of relations cancels restriction of ` r ` in ~ dfrefrels2 , it keeps restriction of ` _I ` : this is why the very similar definitions ~ df-refs , ~ df-syms and ~ df-trs diverge when we switch from (general) sets to relations in ~ dfrefrels2 , ~ dfsymrels2 and ~ dftrrels2 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 20-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfrefrels2(setvar s0) {
  |- wceq(crefrels, crab(s0, crels, wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0))))
} = {
  abeqinbi(s0, crefrels, crels, crefs, wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0)), wbr(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cssr, cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))))
  df-refrels()
  df-refs(s0)
  syl5bb(wcel(cv(s0), crels), wbr(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cssr, cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0)), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))))
  ax-mp(wb(wbr(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cssr, cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))))), wcel(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), universe))
  elv(s0, wcel(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), universe))
  inex1g(cv(s0), universe, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))
  brssr(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), universe, cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))))
  sseq2d(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0), wcel(cv(s0), crels))
  biimpi(wcel(cv(s0), crels), wceq(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0)))
  elv(s0, wb(wcel(cv(s0), crels), wceq(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0))))
  elrels6(cv(s0), universe)
  diff.crels.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dfrefrels2(setvar s0) {
  ‚ä¢ RefRels = { s0 ‚àà Rels |(= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚äÜ s0 }
} = {
  abeqinbi(s0, crefrels, crels, crefs, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚äÜ s0, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))[_S](s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))))
  df-refrels()
  df-refs(s0)
  syl5bb(s0 ‚àà Rels, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))[_S](s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), (= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚äÜ s0, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚äÜ(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))))
  ax-mp(((= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))[_S](s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚Üî(= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚äÜ(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))), (s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚àà ùïå)
  elv(s0, (s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚àà ùïå)
  inex1g(s0, universe, (dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))
  brssr((s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), universe, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))))
  sseq2d((= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), (s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), s0, s0 ‚àà Rels)
  biimpi(s0 ‚àà Rels, (s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))= s0)
  elv(s0, (s0 ‚àà Rels ‚Üî(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))= s0))
  elrels6(s0, universe)
  diff.crels.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: dfrefrels3
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the class of reflexive relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 8-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfrefrels3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wceq(crefrels, crab(s0, crels, wral(s1, cdm(cv(s0)), wral(s2, crn(cv(s0)), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  rabbieq(s0, crefrels, crels, wral(s1, cdm(cv(s0)), wral(s2, crn(cv(s0)), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(s0), cv(s2))))), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0)))
  dfrefrels2(s0)
  idinxpss(s1, s2, cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)), cv(s0))
  diff.cdm.s(s1, cv(s0))
  diff.crn.s(s1, cv(s0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cdm.s(s2, cv(s0))
  diff.crn.s(s2, cv(s0))
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dfrefrels3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  ‚ä¢ RefRels = { s0 ‚àà Rels | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(s0), ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà ran(s0),(s1 = s2 ‚Üí s1[s0]s2)))}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
} = {
  rabbieq(s0, crefrels, crels, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(s0), ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà ran(s0),(s1 = s2 ‚Üí s1[s0]s2))), (= ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚äÜ s0)
  dfrefrels2(s0)
  idinxpss(s1, s2, dom(s0), ran(s0), s0)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, s0)
  diff.crn.s(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cdm.s(s2, s0)
  diff.crn.s(s2, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
}

blocks.name: dfrefrel2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the reflexive relation predicate. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: dfrefrel3
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the reflexive relation predicate. A relation is reflexive iff: for all elements on its domain and range, if an element of its domain is the same as an element of its range, then there is the relation between them. Note that this is definitely not the definition we are accustomed to, like e.g. ~ idref / ~ idrefALT or ~ df-reflexive ` |- ( R Reflexive A <-> ( R C_ ( A X. A ) /\ A. x e. A x R x ) ) ` . It turns out that the not-surprising definition which contains ` A. x e. dom r x r x ` needs symmetry as well, see ~ refsymrels3 . Only when this symmetry condition holds, like in case of equivalence relations, see ~ dfeqvrels3 , can we write the traditional form ` A. x e. dom r x r x ` for reflexive relations. For the special case with square Cartesian product when the two forms are equivalent see ~ idinxpssinxp4 where ` |- ( A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x = y -> x R y ) <-> A. x e. A x R x ) ` . See also similar definition of the converse reflexive relations class ~ dfcnvrefrel3 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 8-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfrefrel3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(wrefrel(c0), wa(wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, crn(c0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))), wrel(c0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  bitri(wrefrel(c0), wa(wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, crn(c0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))), wrel(c0)), wa(wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0), wrel(c0)))
  dfrefrel2(c0)
  anbi1i(wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0), wrel(c0), wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, crn(c0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))))
  idinxpss(s0, s1, cdm(c0), crn(c0), c0)
  diff.cdm.s(s0, c0)
  diff.crn.s(s0, c0)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, c0)
  diff.crn.s(s1, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dfrefrel3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (RefRel(c0)‚Üî(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(c0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[c0]s1)))‚àß Rel(c0)))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  bitri(RefRel(c0), (‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(c0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[c0]s1)))‚àß Rel(c0)), ((= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)))‚äÜ c0 ‚àß Rel(c0)))
  dfrefrel2(c0)
  anbi1i((= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)))‚äÜ c0, Rel(c0), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(c0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[c0]s1))))
  idinxpss(s0, s1, dom(c0), ran(c0), c0)
  diff.cdm.s(s0, c0)
  diff.crn.s(s0, c0)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, c0)
  diff.crn.s(s1, c0)
}

blocks.name: elrefrels2
blocks.content: Element of the class of reflexive relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 23-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm elrefrels2(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, crefrels), wa(wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0), wcel(c0, crels)))
} = {
  rabeqel(hs0, c0, crefrels, crels, wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(hs0)), crn(cv(hs0)))), cv(hs0)))
  dfrefrels2(hs0)
  sseq12d(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(hs0)), crn(cv(hs0)))), cv(hs0), cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  ineq2d(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(hs0)), crn(cv(hs0))), cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  xpeq12d(cdm(cv(hs0)), crn(cv(hs0)), cdm(c0), crn(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  dmeq(cv(hs0), c0)
  rneq(cv(hs0), c0)
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(crels)
  diff.hs0.w(wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elrefrels2(class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà RefRels ‚Üî((= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)))‚äÜ c0 ‚àß c0 ‚àà Rels))
} = {
  rabeqel(hs0, c0, crefrels, crels, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)))‚äÜ c0, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(hs0)√ó ran(hs0)))‚äÜ hs0)
  dfrefrels2(hs0)
  sseq12d((= ‚ãÇ(dom(hs0)√ó ran(hs0))), hs0, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0))), c0, hs0 = c0)
  ineq2d(cid, (dom(hs0)√ó ran(hs0)), (dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)), hs0 = c0)
  xpeq12d(dom(hs0), ran(hs0), dom(c0), ran(c0), hs0 = c0)
  dmeq(hs0, c0)
  rneq(hs0, c0)
  id(hs0 = c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(crels)
  diff.hs0.w((= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)))‚äÜ c0)
}

blocks.name: elrefrels3
blocks.content: Element of the class of reflexive relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 23-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm elrefrels3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, crefrels), wa(wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, crn(c0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))), wcel(c0, crels)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  rabeqel(hs0, c0, crefrels, crels, wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, crn(c0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))), wral(s0, cdm(cv(hs0)), wral(s1, crn(cv(hs0)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1))))))
  dfrefrels3(hs0, s0, s1)
  raleqbidv(s0, cdm(cv(hs0)), cdm(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wral(s1, crn(cv(hs0)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wral(s1, crn(c0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))))
  dmeq(cv(hs0), c0)
  raleqbidv(s1, crn(cv(hs0)), crn(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))
  rneq(cv(hs0), c0)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))
  breq(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0), cv(s1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(crels)
  diff.hs0.w(wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, crn(c0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elrefrels3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà RefRels ‚Üî(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(c0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[c0]s1)))‚àß c0 ‚àà Rels))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  rabeqel(hs0, c0, crefrels, crels, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(c0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[c0]s1))), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(hs0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(hs0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[hs0]s1))))
  dfrefrels3(hs0, s0, s1)
  raleqbidv(s0, dom(hs0), dom(c0), hs0 = c0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(hs0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[hs0]s1)), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(c0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[c0]s1)))
  dmeq(hs0, c0)
  raleqbidv(s1, ran(hs0), ran(c0), hs0 = c0, (s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[hs0]s1), (s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[c0]s1))
  rneq(hs0, c0)
  imbi2d(hs0 = c0, s0 = s1, s0[hs0]s1, s0[c0]s1)
  breq(hs0, c0, s0, s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(crels)
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ran(c0),(s0 = s1 ‚Üí s0[c0]s1))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: elrefrelsrel
blocks.content: For sets, being an element of the class of reflexive relations ( ~ df-refrels ) is equivalent to satisfying the reflexive relation predicate. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: refreleq
blocks.content: Equality theorem for reflexive relation. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 15-Apr-2019.) (Revised by Peter Mazsa, 23-Sep-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm refreleq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wb(wrefrel(c0), wrefrel(c1)))
} = {
  3bitr4g(wceq(c0, c1), wrefrel(c0), wrefrel(c1), wa(wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0), wrel(c0)), wa(wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c1), crn(c1))), c1), wrel(c1)))
  anbi12d(wceq(c0, c1), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0), wrel(c0), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c1), crn(c1))), c1), wrel(c1))
  sseq12d(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0, cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c1), crn(c1))), c1, wceq(c0, c1))
  ineq2d(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0)), cxp(cdm(c1), crn(c1)), wceq(c0, c1))
  xpeq12d(cdm(c0), crn(c0), cdm(c1), crn(c1), wceq(c0, c1))
  dmeq(c0, c1)
  rneq(c0, c1)
  id(wceq(c0, c1))
  releq(c0, c1)
  dfrefrel2(c0)
  dfrefrel2(c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm refreleq(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 = c1 ‚Üí(RefRel(c0)‚Üî RefRel(c1)))
} = {
  3bitr4g(c0 = c1, RefRel(c0), RefRel(c1), ((= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)))‚äÜ c0 ‚àß Rel(c0)), ((= ‚ãÇ(dom(c1)√ó ran(c1)))‚äÜ c1 ‚àß Rel(c1)))
  anbi12d(c0 = c1, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)))‚äÜ c0, Rel(c0), (= ‚ãÇ(dom(c1)√ó ran(c1)))‚äÜ c1, Rel(c1))
  sseq12d((= ‚ãÇ(dom(c0)√ó ran(c0))), c0, (= ‚ãÇ(dom(c1)√ó ran(c1))), c1, c0 = c1)
  ineq2d(cid, (dom(c0)√ó ran(c0)), (dom(c1)√ó ran(c1)), c0 = c1)
  xpeq12d(dom(c0), ran(c0), dom(c1), ran(c1), c0 = c1)
  dmeq(c0, c1)
  rneq(c0, c1)
  id(c0 = c1)
  releq(c0, c1)
  dfrefrel2(c0)
  dfrefrel2(c1)
}

blocks.name: refrelid
blocks.content: Identity relation is reflexive. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: refrelcoss
blocks.content: The class of cosets by ` R ` is reflexive. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 4-Jul-2020.)
